summary: This is the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report and Lieutenant's Logs for August 9, 2019, detailing routine prison operations, counts, staff shortages, and inmate movements. It is significant as it documents the prison's operational status on the day Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide, noting inmates on suicide watch and a dry cell placement.

persons.name: I/M Williams
persons.context: An inmate mentioned in the Evening Watch log entry at 8:21 PM as being moved from ZA unit to suicide watch.

events.title: Daily Prison Operations and Counts
events.description: Routine prison operations at MCC New York including multiple institutional counts, inmate movements between units, staff conducting equipment checks, and monitoring of inmates on suicide watch and in a dry cell.

events.title: Inmate Placed on Dry Cell
events.description: An inmate was placed on a dry cell in R&D holding cell with staff watch, as reported during the Day Watch and Evening Watch shifts.

events.title: Multiple Inmates on Suicide Watch
events.description: The log repeatedly notes inmates on suicide watch, some with inmate companions, as part of the daily sensitive information.

events.title: Treaty Transfer Return
events.description: A treaty transfer return occurred at 3:03 AM after a flight was canceled due to mechanical problems, adding one inmate to the count.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a prison operations log for August 9, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death.
It notes multiple inmates were on suicide watch, some with inmate companions.
An inmate was placed in a dry cell in the R&D holding area under staff watch.
The report indicates significant staff shortages leading to vacated correctional assignments.
The Control Center Fire Panel was reported as inoperative throughout the day.
